title: Broiled  Slow Roasted Butterflied Leg of Lamb With Cumin and Garlic

content.text: 1/4 cup olive oil
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1/4 cup olive oil" )

content.text: 8 cloves garlic, minced
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "8 cloves garlic, minced" )

content.text: 2 1/2 teaspoons salt
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "2 1/2 teaspoons salt" )

content.text: 1 teaspoon pepper
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1 teaspoon pepper" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons ground cumin
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "2 tablespoons ground cumin" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon dried oregano
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1 tablespoon dried oregano" )

content.text: 1 (8 pound) leg of lamb, boned and butterflied to a more or less even thickness, 4 3/4 to 5 1/2 pounds trimmed weight, fell and most fat removed
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 (8 pound) leg of lamb, boned and butterflied to a more or less even thickness, 4 3/4 to 5 1/2 pounds trimmed weight, fell and most fat removed" )

content.text: 1 lemon, juiced
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1 lemon, juiced" )

content.text: Minced fresh parsley, cilantro or mint  (optional)
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "Minced fresh parsley, cilantro or mint  (optional)" )

content.text: 0) Mix oil, garlic, salt, pepper, cumin and oregano; spread paste on both sides of the lamb and let stand for an hour until meat comes to room temperature.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "Mix"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "oil"@7:10 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "garlic"@12:18 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "salt"@20:24 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "pepper"@26:32 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "cumin"@34:39 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "oregano"@44:51 / FOOD )
		:_result ( paste )
	)
	:inform ( ac-0-1 "spread"@53:59 / AC
		:ppt ( paste "paste"@60:65 / FOOD )
		:gol ( ing-6 "both sides of the lamb"@69:91 / FOOD )
		:_result ( pasted-lamb )
	)
	:inform ( ac-0-2 "stand"@100:105 / AC
		:duration ( dur-0-0 "an hour"@110:117 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-0-0 "meat comes to room temperature"@-1:-1 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( pasted-lamb / FOOD )
		:_result ( rested-lamb )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Adjust oven rack to upper or upper-middle position (depending on lamb's thickness) and preheat broiler on high for at least 10 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-1 / R
   :inform ( ac-1-0 "Adjust"@3:9 / AC
      :ppt ( tool-1-0 "oven rack"@10:19 / TOOL )
      :mnr ( "upper or upper-middle position"@23:53 / OTHER )
	:_result adjusted-oven-rack
   )
   :inform ( ac-1-1 "preheat"@90:97 / AC
      :ppt ( tool-1-1 "broiler"@98:105 / TOOL )
      :heat ( "high"@109:113 / TEMPERATURE )
      :duration ( "10 minutes"@127:137 / DUR )
	:_result preheated-broiler
   )
)

content.text: 2) Place lamb, cut side up, on a large wire rack set over a foil-lined roasting pan.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
   :inform ( ac-2-0 "Place"@3:8 / AC
      :ppt ( rested-lamb "lamb, cut side up" / FOOD ) #what to do with side up#
      :gol ( tool-2-0 "a large wire rack set" / TOOL) 
	:over (tool-2-1 "a foil-lined roasting pan" / TOOL)
	:_result lamb-in-pan
   )
)

content.text: 3) Broil, moving pan so entire surface browns evenly, about 8 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R #the recipe may be wrong#
   :inform ( ac-3-0 "Broil"@3:8 / AC
      :duration ( "8 minutes"@60:69 / DUR )
      :ppt ( tool-3-0 "pan"@-1:-1 / TOOL )
      :prp ( "so entire surface browns evenly"@21:52 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
	:_result half-browned-lamb
   )
)

content.text: 4) Turn lamb over; continue to broil until well browned on the other side, about 8 minutes longer.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
   :inform ( ac-4-0 "Turn"@3:7 / AC
      :ppt ( half-browned-lamb "lamb"@8:12 / FOOD )
	:_result (turned-lamb)
   )
   :inform ( ac-4-1 "broil"@31:36 / AC
      :until ( "well browned on the other side" / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
      :duration ( "8 minutes"@81:90 / DUR )
      :ppt ( turned-lamb / FOOD  )
	:_result browned-lamb 
   )
)

content.text: 5) Turn off broiler, remove lamb from oven and let rest for 10 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R 
   :inform ( ac-5-0 "Turn off"@3:11 / AC
      :ppt ( preheated-broiler "broiler" / TOOL )
	:_result off-broiler
   )
   :inform ( ac-5-1 "remove"@21:27 / AC
      :ppt ( browned-lamb "lamb"@28:32 / FOOD )
      :source ( preheated-broiler "broiler" / TOOL )
	:_result lamb-ouside-broiler
   )
   :inform ( ac-5-2 "rest"@51:55 / AC
      :duration ( "10 minutes"@60:70 / DUR )
      :ppt ( lamb-ouside-broiler / FOOD )
	:_result cooled-lamb
   )
)

content.text: 6) Heat oven to 325 degrees.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
   :inform ( "Heat"@3:7 / AC
      :ppt ( tool-6-0 "oven"@8:12 / TOOL )
      :heat ( "325 degrees"@16:27 / TEMPERATURE )
	:_result preheated-oven
   )
)

content.text: 7) Stick a meat thermometer into the thickest portion of the lamb; return it to the oven.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
   :inform ( ac-7-0 "Stick"@3:8 / AC
      :ppt ( "a meat thermometer"@9:27 / TOOL )
      :gol ( cooled-lamb "the thickest portion of the lamb"@33:65 / FOOD )
	:_result lamb-with-thermometer
   )
   :inform ( ac-7-1 "return"@67:73 / AC
      :ppt ( lamb-with-thermometer "it"@74:76 / PRONOUN )
      :gol ( "the oven"@80:88 / FOOD )
	:_result lamb-in-oven
   )
)

content.text: 8) Roast for a total of 50 minutes to 1 hour, until thermometer registers a rosy-pink 140 degrees.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
   :inform ( ac-8-0 "Roast"@3:8 / AC
      :duration ( "50 minutes to 1 hour"@24:44 / DUR )
      :until ( "thermometer registers a rosy-pink 140 degrees"@52:97 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
      :ppt ( lamb-in-oven / FOOD ) 
	:_result roasted-lamb
   )
)

content.text: 9) Check lamb several times after 30 minutes.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform (ac-9-0 "Check" / AC 
		:ppt ( lamb-in-oven "lamb" / FOOD )
		:todo ("several times" / POINT_IN_TIME )
		:duration ("30 minutes" / DUR ) 
		:_result checked-lamb
  )
)

content.text: 10) If lamb gets done sooner, simply turn down oven to 170 degrees until ready to serve.
content.eamr:
( inst-10 / R
	:inform (ac-10-0 "turn down" / AC 
		:ppt (preheated-oven "oven" / TOOL)
		:heat ("170 degrees" / TEMPERATURE )
		:until ("ready to serve" / CONDITION_CLAUSE ) 
		:todo ("lamb gets done sooner" / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:_result cooked-lamb 
  )
)

content.text: 11) As soon as lamb comes out of the oven, squeeze on lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh herbs.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "squeeze"@43:50 / AC
		:when ( "As soon as lamb comes out of the oven"@4:41 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "lemon juice"@54:65 / FOOD )
		:gol (cooked-lamb / FOOD)
		:_result lamb-with-lemon
)
   :inform ( ac-11-1 "sprinkle"@70:78 / AC
      :ppt ( ing-8 "fresh herbs"@84:95 / FOOD )
      :gol ( lamb-with-lemon  / FOOD )
	:_result lamb-with-herbs
   )
)

content.text: 12) Carve, slicing across the grain when possible.
content.eamr:
( inst-12 / R
   :inform ( ac-12-0 "Carve, slicing" / AC
         :ppt ( lamb-with-herbs "the grain"@26:35 / FOOD ) #part of the lamb#
         :when ( "possible" / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	:_result sliced-lamb
      )
)

content.text: 13) Arrange on a platter, drizzle with accumulated juices, and serve.
content.eamr:
( inst-13 / R
   :inform ( ac-13-0 "Arrange"@4:11 / AC
      :loc ( "a platter"@15:24 / TOOL )
      :ppt (  sliced-lamb / FOOD )
	:_result lamb-on-platter
   )
   :inform ( ac-13-1 "drizzle"@26:33 / AC
      :ppt ( "accumulated juices"@39:57 / FOOD )
      :gol ( lamb-on-platter / FOOD )
	:_result lamb-with-juices
   )
   :inform ( ac-13-2 "serve"@63:68 / AC
      :ppt ( lamb-with-juices / FOOD )
	:_result FINAL_PRODUCT
   )
)
